localization.gaussian.ExtendedKalmanFilter¶

class localization.gaussian.ExtendedKalmanFilter(x_dim=1, u_dim=0, z_dim=1)¶

Bases: localization.gaussian.KalmanFilter

Base level class for an Extended Kalman Filte inherited from the base level Kalman Filter. Due to non-linear models, specific implementations must be built with unique models. Use this as a base EKF class and extend it by inheriting and over riding the f(), h(), and calculate_F(), and calculate_H() functions.

__init__(x_dim=1, u_dim=0, z_dim=1)¶

Construct the Kalman filter by providing dimensions.

Parameters

  • x_dim (INT) – Length of the state vector. The default is 1. Used to create

  • u_dim (INT) – Length of the control input vector. The default is 0.

  • z_dim (INT) – Length of the measurement or observation vector. The default is 1.

Returns

The Kalman Filter object

initialize(mu, covariance)¶

Initializes the Kalman Filter about a mean and covariance

Parameters

  • mu (vector or vector-like) – the distribution center

  • covariance (matrix or matrix-like) – the covariance of the distribution

predict(u)¶

Runs the prediction or propagation phase of the EKF.

Parameters

u (vector or vector-like) – control input vector

Used to set the control input matrix B.

Parameters

Executes one cycle of the Kalman Filter

Parameters

  • z (array or array-like) – the measurement or observation vector

Runs the update phase of the EKF

Parameters
